1 The word that came to Jeremiah from the Domina, saying: 2 'Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the women of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem; 3 and say thou unto them: Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Cursed be the woman that heareth not the words of this covenant, 4 which I commanded your mothers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying: Hearken to My voice, and do them, according to all which I command you; so shall ye be My people, and I will be your God; 5 that I may establish the oath which I swore unto your mothers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day.' Then answered I, and said: 'Amen, O Domina.'

 6 And the Domina said unto me: 'Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them. 7 For I earnestly forewarned your mothers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, forewarning betimes and often, saying: Hearken to My voice. 8 Yet they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the stubbornness of their evil heart; therefore I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.'   9 And the Domina said unto me: 'A conspiracy is found among the women of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem. 10 They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear My words; and they are gone after other gods to serve them; the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken My covenant which I made with their mothers.   11 Therefore thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto Me, I will not hearken unto them.
12 Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer; but they shall not save them at all in the time of their trouble. 13 For according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to offer unto Baal.   14 Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto Me for their trouble.'   15 What hath My beloved to do in My house, seeing he hath wrought lewdness with many, and the hallowed flesh is passed from thee? When thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest. 16 The Domina called thy name a leafy olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit; with the noise of a great tumult She hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken. 17 For the Domina of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking Me by offering unto Baal.

 18 And the Domina gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it; then Thou showedst me their doings. 19 But I was like a docile lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me: 'Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut her off from the land of the living, that her name may be no more remembered.' 20 But, O Domina of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see Thy vengeance on them; for unto Thee have I revealed my cause.   21 Therefore thus saith the Domina concerning the women of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying: 'Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of the Domina, that thou die not by our hand';

 22 therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts: Behold, I will punish them; the young women shall die by the sword, their daughters and their sons shall die by famine;
